business.headline: Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

entertainment.headline: It's Okay to Not be Okay to Doctor Slump: Evolution of mental health portrayalK-dramas have evolved significantly in portraying mental health, moving from stigma and stereotypes to nuanced and empathetic storytelling. These dramas now highlight real struggles like trauma, anxiety, and burnout, encouraging open conversations about mental well-being.

Kunal Kohli says Saif did Hum Tum after 3 top stars rejected the classicDirector Kunal Kohli revealed that 'Hum Tum' was originally offered to Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vivek Oberoi before Saif Ali Khan landed the role. The iconic romantic comedy re-released in theatres on May 16.

Parul Gulati reacts to claims that Indian actors 'pay' to be at CannesActor Parul Gulati reacted to Cannes banning 'naked' dressing as she is set to make her debut at the prestigious festival. The actor stated that she did not want to feel pressured by it.
Ironheart trailer: Riri Williams takes forward Tony Stark's Iron Man legacyRiri Williams, played by Dominique Thorne, takes forward Iron Man's legacy in the MCU's 'Ironheart' as a genius inventor.

Rani Mukerji as Suhana Khan's mother in Shah Rukh Khan-Deepika's King: ReportRani Mukerji is set to reunite with Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in Siddharth Anand's upcoming action-thriller 'King', playing a pivotal cameo role. The film begins shooting this month and is slated for a late 2026 release.

Justin Bieber's team addresses rumours of being Sean Diddy's assault victimJustin Bieber's team recently addressed rumours about being sexually assaulted by Sean 'Diddy' Combs.  They mentioned how 'nothing untoward' happened between them.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu gets release date after multiple delaysAfter several delays, Pawan Kalyan's long-anticipated historical action film, 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', is finally gearing up for release on June 12.

Singer Amaal Mallik's family is 'closer, happier' after his decision to break tiesMusic composer Amaal Mallik recently opened up about his battle with depression and the emotional post where he distanced himself from his family. The singer shared that while it initially hurt, his distance has brought his family closer together.

Anaganaga review: A decent film about life beyond marksReleased-Fri May 16, 2025Anaganaga movie review: This Telugu drama film, starring Sumanth in the lead, keeps a mirror in front of the present education system, and hits the right emotional chords to shine light on the problem and the solution.

Vikrant Massey in Karan Johar's Dostana 2 after Kartik Aaryan's exit: ReportVikrant Massey is rumoured to be replacing Kartik Aaryan in Karan Johar's much-delayed Dostana 2, which is expected to begin shooting in January 2026. The film will also star Lakshya and introduce a fresh female lead.

BTS' Jin shares heartbreak anthem Don't Say You Love Me from album EchoBTS's Jin dropped the new music video for the title track, 'Don't Say You Love Me', featuring actor Shin Se-kyung. The song is a part of his album, 'Echo'.

Assamese singer Gayatri Hazarika dies at 44; Assam mourns a cultural iconAssamese singer Gayatri Hazarika had been battling colon cancer for some time. The popular Assamese icon died at a hospital in Guwahati.

Ajay Devgn-Riteish Deshmukh's Dhamaal 4 gears up for Eid 2026 releaseAjay Devgn's Dhamaal 4 is scheduled to release on Eid 2026. The Indra Kumar-directorial also features Riteish Deshmukh and Arshad Warsi.

Jacqueline Fernandez brings old Hollywood glam to Cannes 2025 in red gown. PicsActor Jacqueline Fernandez walked the red carpet of the Cannes International Film Festival as part of the 'Women in Cinema' gala. The actor looked stunning in her jewelled shirt, and also in her red corset gown.

Kurta-clad Shin Chan will dance to Bollywood songs in upcoming film. DetailsShin Chan's new movie, 'Shin Chan: The Spicy Kasukabe Dancers', will be released in theatres in India this October. Our favourite troublemaker is coming back in a desi avatar.

Love you puttar: Sham Kaushal's note for Vicky, brother Sunny sends wishesVicky Kaushal's father, Sham, extended his birthday wishes to his son with a heartfelt note. The actor's brother, Sunny Kaushal, also sent his love.

Samantha consoles emotional crew member at Subham event, fans call her 'gold'Actor Samantha often wins hearts on the internet with her thoughtful gestures. In yet another touching moment captured at the success bash of 'Subham', she was seen consoling an emotional crew member while addressing the media on stage.

My body is filling out: Ananya Panday shuts down 'getting butt done' rumoursAnanya Panday commented on being subjected to body-shaming. The actor addressed the rumours of getting buttock enhancement surgery done in an interview with Lilly Singh.

Samantha and Raj Nidimoru 'considering living together' amid affair rumours: ReportActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and director Raj Nidimoru are 'considering living together' amid affair rumours, according to a recent report. Samantha acted in Raj's spy action-thriller show, 'Ciatdel: Honey Bunny'.

general news.headline: Akashteer, BrahMos: Weapons of war behind Operation Sindoor successOperation Sindoor marked one of the most aggressive responses by India in decades, and it sent a clear message to a neighbour often accused of harbouring terror.

Neeraj Chopra throws record 90.23m, but finishes 2nd in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra finished in second place in the 2025 Doha Diamond League Men's Javelin Throw event on Friday (May 16), despite a record-breaking 90.23-meter throw, as Germany's Julian Weber startled everyone with a final throw of 91.06 meters.

Omar Abdullah vs Mehbooba Mufti over water project after India pauses Indus treatyWhile Omar Abdullah has advocated for the revival of the Tulbul project after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan, Mehbooba Mufti labelled his suggestion "deeply unfortunate" and "dangerously provocative".

Donald Trump's Gulf Tour: Hot, Heavy and StormyFrom gorgeous trade deals to sheikhing it with a man with a bounty on his head, Trump's geopolitics, driven by a shrinking lexicon and fixation on wealth, turns global affairs into a flashy, hot and heavy spectacle.

India's war hero who created a graveyard of Pak's Patton tanks with a gunThe 1965 Indo-Pak War saw the biggest tank battle since World War II. Indian Army Havildar Abdul Hamid drove around in a jeep, mounted with a recoilless gun, through sugarcane fields, destroying Pakistan's US-made Patton tanks. Hamid destroyed up to 12 tanks and laid his life in the line of duty. He was awarded the Param Vir Chakra, India's highest wartime gallantry award.

Turkey's Celebi sues India for revoking security clearance amid Pak conflictCelebi Airport Services India, in a May 16 filing seen by Reuters, asked the Delhi High Court to set aside that decision, arguing it would impact 3,791 jobs and investor confidence.

Pakistan's anti-India propaganda has a victim, its Deputy PM Ishaq DarIn a stunning self-goal, Pakistan's Deputy PM Ishaq Dar quoted a fake headline from a digitally altered frontpage of British newspaper, The Daily Telegraph. Ironically, the fake page had been promoted by the Pakistani establishment's disinformation brigade. Adding to Dar's embarrassment, the farce was also fact-checked by the Pakistani media.

For H-1B visas, 3.4 lakh eligible registrations in FY26, a 27% dropThe US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) received 343,981 eligible registrations for H-1B visas for FY 2026, a 27% decline from the previous year. Despite the fall in eligible registrations, which could be due to increased fees, the huge number shows that H-1B visas still remain popular.

Operation Sindoor: The weapons that made it happenIn this episode of Battle Cry, India Today's Gaurav Sawant brings you details about the weapons that were used by the Indian armed forces in Operation Sindoor to send across a very clear message to Pakistan.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why frenemies India and Afghanistan are talking againOn Friday, S Jaishankar spoke with his Afghan counterpart. It was the first political-level contact between India and Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power. In this edition of The Lowdown, we explain India's past relationship with the Taliban and how the latest development indicates a new bend in the topsy-turvy path to Kabul.

Gujarat Samachar owner gets bail on health grounds hours after arrest by EDA court has granted bail to Gujarat Samachar owner Bahubali Shah, who was arrested by the ED in a money laundering case this morning, on health grounds.
Grade 1 anti-pollution restrictions in Delhi-NCR as air quality turns poorThe pollution monitoring body ordered the implementation of GRAP 1 in Delhi NCR after the air quality degraded on Friday.

How talent-surplus India can leverage developed world's labour crisisDeveloped nations may face a shortage of 45-50 million skilled and semi-skilled workers by 2030. Experts share how Indians can tap this gap

It's Okay to Not be Okay to Doctor Slump: Evolution of mental health portrayalK-dramas have evolved significantly in portraying mental health, moving from stigma and stereotypes to nuanced and empathetic storytelling. These dramas now highlight real struggles like trauma, anxiety, and burnout, encouraging open conversations about mental well-being.

Man who stabbed Salman Rushdie, blinded author in one eye, gets 25-year jail termBefore being sentenced, Hadi Matar stood and made a statement about freedom of speech in which he called Salman Rushdie a hypocrite.

Pak to give Rs 14 crore to Masood Azhar, IMF must rethink loan: Rajnath SinghRajnath Singh, speaking at the Bhuj airbase, claimed that Pakistan has announced financial aid to rebuild the terror infrastructure of Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed in Muridke and Bahawalpur.

Baby healed in world's 1st gene-editing therapy; Indian-origin doc plays key roleAn Indian-origin cardiologist, Kiran Musunuru, played a key role in a groundbreaking medical milestone, helping treat a nine-month-old baby boy with a rare genetic disorder using customised gene-editing therapy. Musunuru was born to Telugu parents who migrated to the US from India.

Boy cries as langoor snatches his food, father films reel. Video sparks outrageThe viral video shows the little boy sitting on a table when a langoor suddenly appears and grabs the food from his hands.

Chinese, Pak air defence systems no match for India's BrahMos: US warfare expertOperation Sindoor: Colonel (Retd) John Spencer said India demonstrated both offensive and defensive superiority during Operation Sindoor, sending a message that it can hit 'anywhere in Pakistan, anytime'.

How Mamata, BJP raced to claim credit for BSF jawan's release from PakistanBoth sides said their efforts had brought Purnam Kumar Shaw back to his Bengal home, and accused one another of political opportunism

Akashteer: India's invisible shield that beat Pak's imported missiles and dronesAkashteer, India's advanced air defence system, emerged as an invisible shield, detecting, tracking and shooting down a barrage of missiles and drones launched by Pakistan during the four-day military confrontation.

sports.headline: KKR has nothing much to lose from here: Manish Pandey ahead of RCB clashKKR batter Manish Pandey has said that the team has nothing much to lose now in the IPL 2025 season and will be aiming for a strong finish to the campaign. KKR will face RCB on May 17 as the IPL campaign restarts.

Neeraj Chopra throws record 90.23m, but finishes 2nd in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra finished in second place in the 2025 Doha Diamond League Men's Javelin Throw event on Friday (May 16), despite a record-breaking 90.23-meter throw, as Germany's Julian Weber startled everyone with a final throw of 91.06 meters.

Neeraj Chopra throws 90.23m: Fans celebrate historic feat of India's best athleteFans erupted in celebration on Friday night as Neeraj Chopra finally breached the elusive 90-metre barrier, recording a mammoth throw of 90.23m at the 2025 Doha Diamond League.

Neeraj breaches 90m mark for 1st time, throws 90.23m in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra was able to finally breach the 90-metre mark for the first time in his career during the Doha Diamond League 2025 on Friday, May 16. Neeraj hit a perfect throw of 90.23m to become the first Indian to go past the mark.

Carlos Alcaraz fights past Musetti to reach Italian Open finalCarlos Alcaraz moved one step closer to a dream showdown with World No. 1 Jannik Sinner at the Italian Open, overcoming a spirited challenge from local favourite Lorenzo Musetti with a composed 6-3, 7-6(4) victory in Friday's semifinal.

Virat Kohli's white jersey tribute from RCB: Director Mo Bobat respondsRCB director of cricket Mo Bobat commented on the tribute planned by the fans for Virat Kohli after the star batter announced his retirement from Test cricket. The RCB fans are planning to wear white jerseys during the clash against KKR on May 17.

Smack one there! Ravi Shastri's message to Rohit Sharma after stand unveilingRavi Shastri gave Rohit Sharma a hilarious message after the stand named after him was unveiled at the Wankhede stadium on Friday, May 16. Rohit was immortalised at the iconic ground for his contributions to Indian cricket.

Shubman Gill picked for India A tour England amid Test captaincy rumoursShubman Gill, rumoured to be the captain of the Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, will play in India A squad matches ahead of the England Test series. Shubman will join the side for the second tour game.

Doha DL Highlights: Julian Weber stuns Neeraj Chopra with final throwNeeraj Chopra in Doha Diamond League, Highlights: Neeraj Chopra has been stunned by Julian Weber's final throw at the Doha Diamond League. Weber puts in a mega throw of 91.06m, which upstages Neeraj's career best throw of 90.23m. Neeraj breaks the 90m mark, but finishes 2nd in the competition.

Karun Nair rewarded with India A call up in squad for England tourThe All-India Senior Selection Committee has announced a 15-member India A squad for the upcoming red-ball tour of England. Abhimanyu Easwaran will lead the side in two first-class matches.

Virat Kohli's Test shirt sales skyrocket, as fans prepare special tributeVirat Kohli's Test cricket retirement sparked a fan campaign to wear his iconic No. 18 jersey at the IPL match. The sale of batter's jerseys have skyrocketed in the streets of Bengaluru.

Rohit was immortalised at the iconic ground for his contributions to Indian cricket.

Shubman Gill picked for India A tour England amid Test captaincy rumoursShubman Gill, rumoured to be the captain of the Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, will play in India A squad matches ahead of the England Test series. Shubman will join the side for the second tour game.

Weber puts in a mega throw of 91.06m, which upstages Neeraj's career best throw of 90.23m. Neeraj breaks the 90m mark, but finishes 2nd in the competition.

Karun Nair rewarded with India A call up in squad for England tourThe All-India Senior Selection Committee has announced a 15-member India A squad for the upcoming red-ball tour of England. Abhimanyu Easwaran will lead the side in two first-class matches.

Virat Kohli's Test shirt sales skyrocket, as fans prepare special tributeVirat Kohli's Test cricket retirement sparked a fan campaign to wear his iconic No. 18 jersey at the IPL match. The sale of batter's jerseys have skyrocketed in the streets of Bengaluru.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
